intro: Hypoxis stellipilis, commonly known as the starry hypoxis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, star-shaped flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hypoxis stellipilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
